result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vong Vang

records.addlTxt:
(3:29 PM cases 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Vong Vang appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Vong Vang. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited.
Prior offenses acknowledged for Repeater enhancers.
Defendant pleads No Contest to 21CF1133 Amended Count 1: Substantial Battery as Repeater without Domestic Abuse Assessment, 22CF588 Count 16: Domestic Felony Intimidation of a Victim as a Repeater and Count 17: Domestic Felony Intimidation of a Victim as a Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF1133 Amended Count 1, 22CF588 Count 16 and Count 17.
Parties request the Court follow the joint sentencing recommendation.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 60 months with the following conditions:
120 days jail, stayed pending further order of the Court on 21CF1133 Count 1. No contact with A.G., X.V. unless approved in writing by A.G., X.V. and the probation agent. Complete a Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through with any recommendations. No violent or abusive contact towards anyone. Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs to include domestic abuse assessments. 2 days credit in case 21CF1133 and 101 days credit in case 22CF588 if probation revoked. Any remaining charges including cases 22CF503, 22CF545 are dismissed and read in.
Plea hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:00 PM cases 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588 called. Defendant Vong Vang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Vong Vang.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense would like time to speak with his client about the offer made from the State. Defense to file a written waiver of personal appearance. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for 9/6/22 at 3:30 PM (via Zoom) al files.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on September 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

(Cases 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588 are called at 10:38 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Vong Vang appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Vong Vang.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF588- Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification- Defense makes argument. State objects to any modification- makes argument. Court denies motion to modify bond. 
Status Conference in call cases: 09/01/2022 at 1:00 PM.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Cases called at 10:55 AM: 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588.
Defendant Vong Vang in court, in custody with Attorney Robert Allen Thorson.  Attorney Angela Beranek appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
STC: 8/19/22 at 10:30 AM.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588 are called at 10:54 AM)  Defendant Vong Vang in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Vong Vang. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information in 21CF1133, waives reading, enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Arraignment in 22CF503, 22CF545, 22CF588 and Status Conference in 21CF1133: 7/22/2022 at 10:45 AM.

(9:38 AM cases 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Vong Vang in court. Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Vong Vang.
Victim/Witness statute complied with.  
Attorney Thorson advises has received an offer from the State and inquires if the defendant has a new case.
State advises defendant does have a new case which is set for a preliminary hearing.
(Off record to allow Attorney Thorson to speak with the defendant.)
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1133, 22CF503, 22CF545 and Court accepts waivers. 
Arraignments scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on May 20, 2022 at 09:35 am.

9:45 AM Cases called: 21CF1133 and 22CF503. Defendant Vong Vang in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Vong Vang.  Attorney Loralee Clark court for State of Wisconsin. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
22CF503: Waives reading of the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. Bond is set. 
21CF1133: Preliminary Hearing needs to be held or waived. 
Both cases set for a STC: 05/20/22 at 9:35am
